description:
A couple of abseils and a few climb downs. The canyon walls are 5 or 6 times taller than the creek is wide.

Approach

Follow the ridge down into the creek, passing a few minor cliffs, mostly taken direct.

Descent

Exit

About 50m back from the Bowens junction, you can exit on the true right up ledges to a steep dirt ridge, which unfortunately sends you in the wrong direction. Bash up this for a while, then contour and descend back to the head of the canyon, then retrace your approach route.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Zircon Creek
